definitions.definition: A method, device or medication that restores good health.
Act of healing or state of being healed; restoration to health after a disease, or to soundness after injury.
A process of preservation, as by smoking.
A process of solidification or gelling.
A process whereby a material is caused to form permanent molecular linkages by exposure to chemicals, heat, pressure and/or weathering.
Spiritual charge; care of soul; the office of a parish priest or of a curate.
That which is committed to the charge of a parish priest or of a curate.
To bring (a disease or its bad effects) to an end.
To cause to be rid of (a defect).
definitions.example: Experience will cure him of his naïveté.

definitions.definition: To prepare or alter especially by chemical or physical processing for keeping or use.
definitions.example: The smoke and heat cures the meat.

definitions.definition: To bring about a cure of any kind.
To be undergoing a chemical or physical process for preservation or use.
definitions.example: The meat was put in the smokehouse to cure.
The parts were curing in the autoclave.

definitions.definition: To pay heed; to care; to give attention.
